whatIs.title: What is a Headless PoC?
whatIs.body1: It’s a concrete test of your site or application in headless mode, built on a real portion of your domain (e.g. product landing, category page, customer area). We work on top of the existing stack: no full replatforming, no big bang.
whatIs.body2: The goal is to let business, design and IT see and touch performance, UX and integrations with current systems.
whatIs.pillMarketingBody: Validate a new UX on part of the site before investing in a full redesign.
whatIs.pillItBody: Test a headless stack, BFF and integrations without touching the whole monolith.
whatIs.whenItem1: You want to modernise the front-end but a full replatforming is too risky or expensive.
whatIs.whenItem2: You need to convince internal stakeholders with something concrete, not only slides and documents.
whatIs.whenItem3: You want a reusable foundation as a first step towards the new architecture.

timeline.title: How it works: PoC in 5 days
timeline.subtitle: A lean process designed to minimise the time required from your team and maximise the value of the demo.
timeline.note: Timings refer to a standard PoC; we adapt scope to your context.

1.title: Kickoff & scope
1.body: Align on goals, select the page or feature to bring to headless, define the minimum integrations.

2.title: Design & UX
2.body: UI proposal based on your existing brand, with optimisations for conversion and performance.

3.title: Build & integrations
3.body: Next.js development, connection to API / BFF / headless CMS, tracking and Core Web Vitals setup.

4.title: Demo & next steps
4.body: Guided demo, feedback collection, discussion on roll-out and potential go-live.

architecture.title: A modern architecture, on top of the existing one
architecture.body: We use a BFF (Backend For Frontend) approach and/or a headless CMS to connect the new front-end to your current stack, keeping the PoC isolated but ready to grow.
architecture.boxNewFrontendBody: Next.js / React, UI optimised for Core Web Vitals, modern routing, analytics integration.
architecture.boxCmsBody: Content, copy, images and configuration management for the PoC.
architecture.boxLegacyBody: Monolith, e-commerce, CRM, ERP, internal services. The PoC talks to them via APIs or proxy.
architecture.afterPocBody: The PoC is not a throwaway prototype: it can be the first piece of the new architecture, extended to more pages or flows.
architecture.afterPocItem1: Can be promoted to production with a few adjustments.
architecture.afterPocItem2: Gradual roadmap: from PoC to continuous roll-out.
architecture.afterPocItem3: Technical documentation for your team or partner.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.q1: Could this break something on the current site?
faq.a1: No: we pick an isolated portion (e.g. subdomain or dedicated path) and integrate in read-only mode with your systems. No risky deploys on the monolith.
faq.q2: How much does our team need to be involved?
faq.a2: We structure the PoC to require as little time as possible: typically one joint kickoff and a few technical checks for access and APIs.
faq.a3: Yes, if we agree on this from the start: we already build with production-grade quality so you can decide to promote it with minimal changes.
faq.q4: Can we reuse your best practices internally?
faq.a4: Absolutely: we can do a full handover to your team or keep supporting you as a technical partner.
